page.title: 19Elstree Aerodrome
page.content: We travelled to Elstree Aerodrome by car and so we passed the reservoir and the blood laboratory. When we reached the area we walked along a public pathway and had to climb over the stiles. This path took us along the perimeter of the airfield. We got a really good look. There were about twenty aeroplanes in a compound. They were all light weight aeroplanes owned by people who have flying as their hobby. Many of the members fly as far as Europe at the weekend and just stop to do their shopping! It is a very expensive hobby. Learning to fly costs thousands of pounds, and then there is the cost of the plane and fuel. For this reason some people share a plane, but apart from lessons and occasional deliveries the aerodrome is not used for business.
